lead_paragraph: German investigators found evidence that may link the young man to the Islamic State, but denied a firm connection with the group despite it claiming responsibility.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Mohamad Fahim Abed and Mujib Mashal from Kabul, Afghanistan; Mona Boshnaq from London; Rukmini Callimachi from New York; Victor Homola from Berlin; and Alan Wong from Hong Kong.

headline.print_headline: Afghan Teenager Spoke of Friend’s Death Before Attack in Germany
headline.main: Afghan Teenager Spoke of Friend’s Death Before Ax Attack in Germany

snippet: German investigators found evidence that may link the young man to the Islamic State, but denied a firm connection with the group despite it claiming responsibility....
abstract: Unidentified seventeen-year-old Afghan refugee carries out lethal knife and ax attack in Wurzburg, Germany, leading to hospitalization of five people; Islamic State has claimed responsibility for attack, which comes just days after Tunisian man ran over and killed 84 people at Bastille Day celebration in France.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
